New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit a career-high 47th homer
Ohtani's homer was the fastest recorded at 118.1 mph
Tommy Edman hit four homers in a 24-hour span
Key Match Events: The Dodgers scored five runs in the first inning with four home runs
Shohei Ohtani walked and stole his 48th base in the second inning
Ohtani hit a two-out, two-run single to center field in the third inning
Pre-Game Insights: No pre-game insights provided in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Max Muncy commented on Ohtani's performance
Tommy Edman was impressed with Ohtani's prowess
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers avoided a three-game sweep
The victory pushed their National League West lead to five games over Arizona and 5½ over San Diego
The game reduced their magic number to clinch the division title to 12 with 16 games to play
Others: Bobby Miller probably pitched himself out of a potential playoff rotation spot with his second straight shoddy start
Reliever Daniel Hudson replaced Miller in the fifth and walked two batters
An error by second baseman Chris Taylor on Nico Hoerner’s potential double-play grounder loaded the bases
Pete Crow-Armstrong's single tied the score 7-7
Teoscar Hernández, returning to the lineup, singled with two out in the eighth
Evan Phillips retired the side in order in the eighth
Michael Kopech survived a harrowing ninth
The Cubs gifted the Dodgers an out when Suzuki was thrown out attempting to steal third
Busch struck out to end the game
